channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Persistent flooding on Old Gloucester Road (B4634) creating serious danger to road users and pedestrians - unresolved, 15th February
item.description:
I previously reported this on 6th Feb 2026 ( FixMyStreet ref: 8856534) - but the report was closed next working day with the comment:- ‘This enquiry has been addressed, no further updates will be shared here.’ The issue remains unresolved despite my report being marked as addressed. Could you please confirm: • whether any works or inspections have been carried out, • whether remedial action is planned, and • the approximate timescale for a permanent solution. Given the ongoing safety risk to pedestrians, cyclists and motorists, I would appreciate an update.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Old Gloucester Road, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The road is in an awful state, with multiple potholes, uneven surface and broken speed bumps. It’s extremely difficult to drive down and its likely to cause damage to cars now., 15th February
item.description:
It’s a large section of the road from the bridge up towards the church.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Malvern Road, Alstone, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Numerous potholes & speed bumps with chunks missing, 15th February
item.description:
Outside CLC, numerous potholes with speed bumps littered with holes and chunks missing
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Malvern Road, Alstone, Cheltenham

item.title: Bridge surface is slippery when wet, 15th February
item.description:
All bridges on this bridge path are slippery (there are 3). The bridleway runs behind Wingmoor tip and between Brockhampton and Stoke Orchard. This issue makes riding over the bridges of concern for rider and horse safety
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brockhampton Lane, Kingsditch, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 120cm long 125mm deep (at least ) pothole absolutely destroyed the wheel and tyre of my car! 5 minutes later another car hit this pothole and broke down at the same lay-by as me (30m away). This needs to be sorted ASAP before a motorcyclist hits this and it will kill them !!, 15th February
item.description:
Right outside Ashmead cottage barn mews. You won’t be able to miss it, it’s a creator.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Leckhampton Hill, Shurdington, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Damaged railings, 14th February
item.description:
As you enter Hesters Way Park look to the far right corner and the broken railings should be there. They were too heavy to collect as part of our monthly litter pick.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Princess Elizabeth Way, Benhall, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: There are 15/20 potholes between junction 12 and junction 11a northbound, 14th February
item.description:
Mostly in lane 1 m5 north between junction 12 and 11A. varying in degree. They have been getting worse over the last month
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): M5, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Multiple Pot Holes Under Railway Bridge, 14th February
item.description:
Previously reported and allegedly fixed. Council have poorly repaired - some holes fixed, but surrounding ones left. Area that has been fixed uneven and rough. Still impossible to ride over by cycle. Only safe way round it is to avoid and use the wrong side of the carriageway. Whole width of the width of the west bound carriageway needs resurfacing not patching.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gretton Road, Gotherington, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Multiple potholes and only the most minor have been repaired!, 14th February
item.description:

item.title: Road flooded for weeks. Brook close by has plenty of capacity. So please unblock drains or install new drains a short distance from road to brook. It's been like this for at least 2 years. Not good enough., 14th February
item.description:
An area on both sides of road flooded - a distance of about 75 meters. Slowing down traffic in both directions.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Old Gloucester Road, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tarmac is breaking up around road grate as vehicles attempt to avoid grate., 14th February
item.description:
Grate is at side of road but because a hedge has been planted right on the side of the road and grown out vehicles have been pushed across road. In addition there are large stones at the base of the hedge.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dog Lane, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury

item.title: Water flowing out of field, 14th February
item.description:
Water is flowing out of the field onto and flooding the road around the junction and up dog lane before flowing into a ditch. Will be lethal on this corner when it freezes
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bentham Lane, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury
